Class ec.vatimpl.Root 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.vatimpl.Root
public class Root
extends Object
implements Tether
A Root is a tether whose target is inside a Vat owned by this objectspace. There is no external way to create a Root--they are created as a consequence of passing a message through a Leaf. Roots, as the name implies, are roots for EGC. Note that the constructor for Roots always happens in the vat for that root, but that all other method calls should be happening from some other non-vat thread.

Root(StandardVat, Object)
Create a Root.

Root 
 public Root(StandardVat theVat,
             Object theTarget)
Create a Root.

Parameters:
theVat - the vat that this Root points into
theTarget - the target object that this Root points at

finalize 
 protected void finalize()
Override of method in java.lang.Object. In this case, when a Root is finalized, it decreases the vat's rootTable's ref-count for it and removes the target from the rootTable if the ref-count reaches 0.
